enums.name: BindingType
enums.description: BindingType represents the type of binding.

values.name: BINDING_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified binding type.

values.name: BINDING_TYPE_GROUP
values.description:
TYPE_GROUP denotes a binding type that associates
permissions with a group, enabling access control
based on group membership.

values.name: BINDING_TYPE_SERVICE
values.description:
TYPE_SERVICE denotes a binding type that associates
permissions with a service account, allowing automated
processes to access data sources.

values.name: MANAGED_DIRECTORY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Managed Directory Type.

values.name: MANAGED_DIRECTORY_TYPE_OKTA
values.description: OKTA Directory Type.

values.name: MANAGED_DIRECTORY_TYPE_CISCO
values.description: Cisco Directory Type.

messages.name: Air
messages.description: An PyramID instance

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the PyramID instance.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: catalog_id
fields.description: The ID of the PyramID Catalog.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: authorization_context_id
fields.description: The identifier for the PyramID Authorization context.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description: Header name.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: Header value.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: AuthorizationContext
messages.description:
AuthorizationContext represents the configuration used to authorize entities
calling functions within the configured data sources.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the authorization context, used to distinguish
it from other contexts within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: authorization_parameters
fields.description: Allowed Authorization Parameters.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: managed_directory
fields.description: Managed Directory for the AD sync.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: AuthorizationParameters
messages.description: Authorization Parameters

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: Allowed Authorization issuer.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aud
fields.description: Allowed audience.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: cids
fields.description: Allowed Authorization clients.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: Allowed Authorization scopes.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Binding
messages.description:
Binding represents an association between groups or service accounts and
domains, defining what domains within data sources can be accessed by
specific groups or service accounts in an PyramID instance.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An unique identifier for the binding.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the binding, as defined by BindingType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: AirID is the identifier of the PyramID instance associated with this binding.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: groups
fields.description:
Groups is a list of allowed user groups associated with this binding,
mapping group members to accessible domains within data sources.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: services
fields.description:
Services is a list of allowed service accounts associated with this binding,
mapping service accounts to accessible domains within data sources.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: domain_ids
fields.description:
DomainIDs is a list of allowed domain identifiers associated with this binding,
specifying the domains in data sources that the groups or service accounts can access.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Group
messages.description:
Group represents a collection of users or entities,
identified by a unique ID and a name.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An unique identifier for the group.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description: A name for the group.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ManagedDirectory
messages.description: Managed Directory for the AD sync.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the managed directory configuration, used to
distinguish it from other configurations in the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of managed directory, as defined by ManagedDirectoryType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: org_url
fields.description:
OrgUrl is the URL of the organization's directory service. It typically points
to the administrative interface or API endpoint for the managed directory.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: org_id
fields.description:
OrgId is the identifier for the organization within the managed directory service.
It is used to uniquely identify the organization's directory instance (optional).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: api_client_id
fields.description:
ApiClientId is the client ID for accessing the managed directory's API.
It is used as part of the credentials to authenticate API requests.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: api_secret
fields.description:
ApiSecret is the secret key used in conjunction with the ApiClientId to authenticate
API requests to the managed directory.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyramid
fields.description: The PyramID to create.

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: PyramID Id to delete.

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: PyramID Id to get.

fields.name: page
fields.description: The current page of the pagination
fields.label: optional

fields.name: size
fields.description: The page size of the pagination
fields.label: optional

fields.name: query
fields.description: The search query
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyramids
fields.description: A list of PyramID instances.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pagination
fields.description: Pagination response.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: PyramID Id to update.

fields.name: pyramid
fields.description: PyramID parameters to update.

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: The id of the PyramID instance

fields.name: bindings
fields.description: A list of PyramID bindings.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pyramid_id
fields.description: The id of the PyramID instance.

fields.name: bindings
fields.description: The list of modified PyramID bindings
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: bindings
fields.description: A list of PyramID bindings.
fields.label: repeated

methods.name: UpdateBindings
methods.description: Update the list of PyramID bindings for a specific PyramID instance.

enums.name: FunctionType
enums.description:
FunctionType represents the type of function that can be executed.
It enumerates the different types of functions available.

values.name: FUNCTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Function Type.

values.name: FUNCTION_TYPE_HTTP
values.description: TYPE_HTTP represents a function type that communicates via HTTP.

values.name: FUNCTION_TYPE_BYOF
values.description:
TYPE_BYOF represents a "Bring Your Own Function" type,
allowing functions with custom code to be executed.

enums.name: OpenApiAuthType
enums.description:
OpenApiAuthType represents the authentication method used for accessing a web service.
It enumerates the different types of authentication that can be configured.

values.name: OPEN_API_AUTH_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description:
Indicates that no specific authentication type has been specified.
This can be used as a default or placeholder value.

values.name: OPEN_API_AUTH_TYPE_BASIC
values.description:
AUTH_TYPE_BASIC represents basic authentication,
which typically involves using a username and password.

values.name: OPEN_API_AUTH_TYPE_API_KEY
values.description:
AUTH_TYPE_API_KEY represents API key authentication,
where a unique key is used to authenticate requests.

values.name: OPEN_API_AUTH_TYPE_OIDC
values.description:
AUTH_TYPE_OIDC represents OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication,
a simple identity layer on top of the OAuth2 protocol.

values.name: OPEN_API_AUTH_TYPE_OAUTH2
values.description:
AUTH_TYPE_OAUTH2 represents OAuth2 authentication,
a protocol for authorization that provides secure delegated access.

enums.name: ParameterType
enums.description:
ParameterType represents the type of a parameter used in a function.
It enumerates the different data types that a parameter can have.

values.name: PARAMETER_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Parameter Type.

values.name: PARAMETER_TYPE_STRING
values.description: TYPE_STRING represents a parameter of type string.

values.name: PARAMETER_TYPE_INTEGER
values.description: TYPE_INTEGER represents a parameter of type integer.

values.name: PARAMETER_TYPE_FLOAT
values.description: TYPE_FLOAT represents a parameter of type float.

values.name: PARAMETER_TYPE_BOOLEAN
values.description: TYPE_BOOLEAN represents a parameter of type boolean.

enums.name: RuntimeType
enums.description:
RuntimeType represents the type of runtime environment available for execution.
It enumerates the different runtime environments supported by the system.

values.name: RUNTIME_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Runtime Type.

values.name: RUNTIME_TYPE_OPEN_API
values.description:
TYPE_OPEN_API represents a runtime environment configured
to interact with data sources following the OpenAPI specification.

values.name: RUNTIME_TYPE_SPLUNK_ENT
values.description:
TYPE_SPLUNK_ENT represents a runtime environment configured
to interact with Splunk Enterprise data sources.

values.name: RUNTIME_TYPE_SALESFORCE
values.description:
TYPE_SALESFORCE represents a runtime environment configured
to interact with Salesforce data sources.

enums.name: SourceType
enums.description:
SourceType represents the type of data source, indicating the origin
or nature of the data being accessed or managed.

values.name: SOURCE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Source Type.

values.name: SOURCE_TYPE_OPEN_API
values.description:
TYPE_OPEN_API represents a data source that follows
the OpenAPI specification for defining API interfaces.

values.name: SOURCE_TYPE_SPLUNK_ENT
values.description:
TYPE_SPLUNK_ENT represents a data source originating
from a Splunk Enterprise instance, typically used for log and data analysis.

values.name: SOURCE_TYPE_SALESFORCE
values.description:
TYPE_SALESFORCE represents a data source from a Salesforce
instance, commonly used for customer relationship management (CRM) data.

messages.name: Catalog
messages.description:
Catalog represents a data catalog within an PyramID instance, providing
a structured collection of metadata about available data resources.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the data catalog, used to distinguish it
from other catalogs within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description: A human-readable name for the data Catalog.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description for the data Catalog.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Domain
messages.description:
Domain represents a logical grouping of functions and metadata,
providing a unique identity and description for a specific domain of functionality.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the Domain, used to distinguish it
from other domains within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is a human-readable name for the Domain, providing an easily
recognizable and descriptive label for the domain's purpose or area of functionality.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description offers a human-readable explanation of the Domain's purpose,
detailing what the domain encompasses and its role within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: functions
fields.description:
Functions is a list of functions exposed by the Domain. These functions
represent the operations or services provided by the domain, allowing
interaction with the domain's capabilities.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Function
messages.description: Function represents a callable function with specified arguments and return values.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the function, used to distinguish it
from other functions.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the identifier for the function. It must consist of alphanumeric
characters, underscores, or dashes, with a maximum length of 64 characters.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description provides a brief explanation of the function's purpose and usage,
which is used by the model to determine when and how to call the function.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the function, as defined by FunctionType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: arguments
fields.description: Arguments is a list of parameters that the function accepts when called.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: return_values
fields.description: ReturnValues is a list of parameters that the function returns upon execution.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: feid
fields.description:
Feid is a function execution identifier, used to execute the function
in the runtime environment.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: auths
fields.description:
Auths is a list of identifiers for custom authentication methods used
during the function's execution.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: OAuthFlow
messages.description:
OAuthFlow represents a single OAuth 2.0 flow configuration. It defines the
necessary endpoints and scopes required for a specific type of OAuth 2.0 flow.

fields.name: authorization_url
fields.description:
AuthorizationUrl is the URL to the authorization endpoint for obtaining
user consent and authorization. It is used to initiate the OAuth 2.0 flow.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: token_url
fields.description:
TokenUrl is the URL to the token endpoint where the application exchanges
the authorization code or credentials for an access token.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: refresh_url
fields.description:
RefreshUrl is the URL to the refresh endpoint, which is used to obtain a new
access token by using a refresh token, allowing continued access without
re-authentication.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: scopes
fields.description:
Scopes is a map of available scopes for the OAuth 2.0 flow. Each key is a scope
name, and the value is a description of what the scope allows.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: OAuthFlows
messages.description:
OAuthFlows represents a collection of supported OAuth 2.0 flows.
Each flow provides a different method for acquiring an access token.

fields.name: implicit
fields.description:
Implicit flow is where the access token is returned directly in the redirect
URI fragment, suitable for client-side applications.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: password
fields.description:
Password flow allows resource owner credentials (username and password)
to be exchanged directly for an access token.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: client_credentials
fields.description:
ClientCredentials flow is used by applications to obtain an access token
using their client credentials, without user interaction.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: authorization_code
fields.description:
AuthorizationCode flow involves obtaining an authorization code which is
exchanged for an access token, suitable for server-side applications.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiArgumentsConfig
messages.description:
OpenApiArgumentsConfig defines the configuration for handling OpenAPI parameters
during the parsing phase. It determines how parameters should be processed and
included in the data source configuration.

fields.name: required_only
fields.description:
RequiredOnly indicates whether only the required parameters should be included
in the data source configuration. If set to true, optional parameters will be
excluded, ensuring focus on the parameters necessary for the API operation.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiAuth
messages.description:
OpenApiAuth represents the authentication configuration for accessing an API.
It supports multiple authentication schemes, allowing flexibility based on the API's requirements.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type specifies the authentication method to be used. It indicates which of the
following authentication configurations is applicable for the API.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: basic
fields.description:
Basic contains the configuration for HTTP Basic Authentication. It includes
credentials such as a username and password for authentication.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: api_key
fields.description:
ApiKey contains the configuration for API Key Authentication. It specifies the
key name, location (header, query, or cookie), and value required for authenticating requests.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: oidc
fields.description:
Oidc contains the configuration for OpenID Connect (OIDC) Authentication.
It includes the URL of the OIDC provider's discovery endpoint to facilitate authentication.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: oauth2
fields.description:
Oauth2 contains the configuration for OAuth 2.0 Authentication. It defines
the supported OAuth flows and their corresponding endpoints and scopes.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiAuthApiKey

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the key name used to identify the API key in requests.
This name is often required by the web service to recognize the API key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: in
fields.description:
In specifies the location where the API key should be included in requests.
It can be one of "header", "query", or "cookie", indicating whether the
API key is sent as an HTTP header, a query parameter, or a cookie.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value is the actual API key used to authenticate requests to the web service.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiAuthBasic
messages.description:
OpenApiAuthBasic represents the basic authentication credentials
for accessing an web service. It includes a username and password
that are typically used for HTTP Basic Authentication.

fields.name: username
fields.description:
Username is the identifier used to authenticate with the web service.
It is usually required along with the password to gain access.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: password
fields.description:
Password is the secret key used in conjunction with the username
to authenticate and authorize access to the web service.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiAuthOAuth2
messages.description:
OpenApiAuthOAuth2 represents the configuration for OAuth 2.0 authentication.
It contains the details of the OAuth flows supported by the API.

fields.name: flows
fields.description:
Flows defines the OAuth 2.0 flows available for authentication, providing
flexibility in how clients can authenticate and obtain access tokens.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiAuthOIDC
messages.description:
OpenApiAuthOIDC represents the configuration for OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication.
It contains the necessary information to perform OIDC-based authentication flows.

fields.name: open_id_connect_url
fields.description:
OpenIdConnectUrl is the URL of the OpenID Connect provider's discovery endpoint.
This URL is used to obtain configuration information about the provider, such as
the authorization and token endpoints, supported scopes, and other necessary details
for performing OIDC authentication.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OpenApiParameters
messages.description:
OpenApiParameters holds the configuration details for an OpenAPI data source.
It includes information about the source name, API specification, hostname,
security schemes, and argument configurations needed to interact with the API.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the identifier for the data source, providing a human-readable
label that describes the source's purpose or functionality.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: spec_url
fields.description:
SpecUrl is the URL to the OpenAPI specification JSON document. This URL points
to the location of the API's specification, which defines the available
endpoints, operations, and data models.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: api_hostname
fields.description:
ApiHostname specifies the hostname of the API server to be called.
It identifies the server where the API requests should be directed.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: security_schemes
fields.description:
SecuritySchemes is a map of security scheme configurations used to authenticate
and authorize API requests. Each key is a scheme name, and each value is an
OpenApiAuth object detailing the authentication parameters.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: arguments
fields.description:
Arguments provides the configuration for handling OpenAPI parameters,
detailing how parameters should be processed during the parsing phase.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Parameter
messages.description:
Parameter defines a parameter that can be used in a function's arguments
or return values. It specifies the parameter's name, description, and type.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the identifier for the parameter. It must consist of alphanumeric
characters, underscores, or dashes, with a maximum length of 64 characters.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description provides a brief explanation of the parameter's purpose and usage.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type indicates the data type of the parameter, as defined by ParameterType.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ParameterValue
messages.description:
ParameterValue is used during runtime to hold the value of each parameter
passed to a function. It associates a parameter's name with its provided
value, enabling the execution of functions with dynamic input.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the identifier for the parameter being passed to the function.
It specifies which parameter the provided value corresponds to, ensuring
the correct association of values during function execution.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description:
Value is the actual value assigned to the parameter during runtime.
This value is used as input to the function, influencing its behavior
and outcome based on the provided parameters.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Runtime
messages.description:
Runtime represents a specific runtime environment configuration, including
the type of runtime and associated parameters required for execution.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the runtime configuration, used to distinguish
it from other runtime configurations in the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of runtime environment, as defined by RuntimeType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: splunk_ent_parameters
fields.description:
SplunkEntParameters contains configuration details specific to a Splunk
Enterprise runtime, including connection and authentication info.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: open_api_parameters
fields.description:
OpenApiParameters contains configuration details specific to an OpenAPI
runtime, including API specification and connection info.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: salesforce_parameters
fields.description:
SalesforceParameters contains configuration details specific to a Salesforce
runtime, including connection and authentication info.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: RuntimeContext
messages.description:
RuntimeContext represents the execution context for a runtime, specifying
the sources that can be executed and the runtime configuration used.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the execution context, used to distinguish
it from other execution contexts in the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: source_ids
fields.description:
SourceIds is a list of identifiers for the sources that can be run within
this execution context, defining the scope of operations possible.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: runtime_id
fields.description:
RuntimeId specifies the identifier of the runtime configuration that can
be used in this context, linking the execution context to a specific runtime setup.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SalesforceParameters
messages.description:
SalesforceParameters holds the configuration details required to connect
to a Salesforce instance. It includes the host address and the necessary
OAuth credentials for authentication.

fields.name: host
fields.description:
Host specifies the address of the Salesforce instance.
This could be a domain name or an IP address, used to direct API requests
to the correct Salesforce server.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: consumer_key
fields.description:
ConsumerKey is the OAuth consumer key provided by Salesforce.
It is used as part of the authentication process to identify the client
application making the API requests.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: consumer_secret
fields.description:
ConsumerSecret is the OAuth consumer secret provided by Salesforce.
This secret, used in conjunction with the consumer key, helps authenticate
the client application.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Source
messages.description:
Source represents a data source configuration, including metadata and
parameters needed to access and interact with the source's data.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the source, used to distinguish it
from other sources in the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is a human-readable name for the Source, providing a descriptive
label that summarizes the source's purpose or functionality.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description offers a human-readable explanation of the Source's purpose,
detailing what the source encompasses and its role within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: catalog_id
fields.description: CatalogID is a reference to the parent catalog that this source belongs to.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Deprecated.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: domains
fields.description:
Domains is a list of domains exposed by the Source, representing the
functional areas or capabilities provided by the source.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the source, as defined by SourceType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: logo_url
fields.description:
LogoUrl is the URL to the logo image for the source, which can be used
in user interfaces to visually represent the source.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: open_api_parameters
fields.description:
OpenApiParameters contains the configuration details specific to
an OpenAPI source type, including API specification and connection info.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: splunk_ent_parameters
fields.description:
SplunkEntParameters contains the configuration details specific to
a Splunk Enterprise source type, including connection and authentication info.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: salesforce_parameters
fields.description:
SalesforceParameters contains the configuration details specific to
a Salesforce source type, including connection and authentication info.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SplunkEntParameters
messages.description:
SplunkEntParameters holds the configuration details required to connect
to a Splunk Enterprise server. This includes the server's host address
and the necessary authentication credentials.

fields.name: host
fields.description:
Host specifies the address of the Splunk Enterprise server.
This could be an IP address or a fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: username
fields.description:
Username is the account username used to authenticate with the Splunk Enterprise server.
It is required for establishing a secure connection and accessing the server's resources.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: password
fields.description:
Password is the account password corresponding to the Username.
It is used to authenticate the connection to the Splunk Enterprise server.
fields.label: optional

enums.name: ByofFunctionRuntimeType
enums.description:
ByofFunctionRuntimeType represents the runtime environment in which
a BYOF function is executed, defining the supported languages or platforms.

values.name: BYOF_FUNCTION_RUNTIME_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Function Runtime Type.

values.name: BYOF_FUNCTION_RUNTIME_TYPE_PYTHON
values.description:
TYPE_PYTHON represents a runtime environment that
executes functions written in Python.

enums.name: ByofFunctionType
enums.description:
ByofFunctionType represents the type of "Bring Your Own Function" (BYOF),
categorizing the function based on its target system.

values.name: BYOF_FUNCTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Function Type.

values.name: BYOF_FUNCTION_TYPE_GENERAL
values.description: TYPE_GENERAL represents a general-purpose function type.

values.name: BYOF_FUNCTION_TYPE_SPLUNK
values.description: TYPE_SPLUNK represents a function type specifically designed for use with Splunk.

messages.name: ByofFunction
messages.description:
ByofFunction represents a "Bring Your Own Function" (BYOF) configuration,
including metadata, implementation details, and function parameters.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the function, used to distinguish it
from other functions within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: catalog_id
fields.description: CatalogID is a reference to the catalog that this function belongs to.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the function, as defined by ByofFunctionType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: runtime_type
fields.description:
RuntimeType specifies the runtime environment for the function,
as defined by ByofFunctionRuntimeType.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name is the human-readable name of the function, providing a descriptive
label that summarizes the function's purpose or functionality.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description offers a human-readable explanation of the function's purpose,
detailing what the function does and its role within the system.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: implementation
fields.description:
Implementation contains the code that defines the function's behavior.
Check ByofFunctionRuntimeType to see the supported environments.
Required when choosing ByofFunctionType_BYOF_FUNCTION_TYPE_GENERAL as a type.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: arguments
fields.description: Arguments is a list of parameters that the function accepts when called.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: return_values
fields.description: ReturnValues is a list of parameters that the function returns upon execution.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: optimized_implementation
fields.description: OptimizedImplementation contains an LLM optimized version of the function's code.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: splunk_query
fields.description:
SplunkQuery contains a query specific to Splunk, used to perform searches
or retrieve data from a Splunk instance.
Required when choosing ByofFunctionType_BYOF_FUNCTION_TYPE_SPLUNK as a type.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: FunctionTestResult
messages.description:
FunctionTestResult represents the outcome of testing a function,
including the result of the test and any error messages encountered.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Result contains the output or result of the function test, if successful.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: error
fields.description:

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
